meanings.sent1: He had to reweld the broken metal piece.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic will reweld the exhaust pipe to fix it.
meanings.sent3: The robot decided to reweld its own arm after it fell off.
meanings.sent4: She had to reweld her trust in him after he let her down.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith's hands moved skillfully to reweld the iron gate.

meanings.definition: To join together by welding again.
meanings.sent1: The welder will reweld the two pipes to make them stronger.
meanings.sent2: After the accident, they had to reweld the metal beams for safety.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to reweld their broken toy using play tools.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like rewelding a bond that had once been broken.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully rewelded the sculpture to its base, ensuring stability.
